intro: Trichera foreziensis, commonly known as the Foreziensis trichera, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are palmate, with lobed edges, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
